text: now we've got some great news to bring
you from the ty cave we're hearing that
all of the children and their coach have
now been rescued from that cave and now
the final thing that needs to be done is
that the doctor and the three Navy SEAL
divers who have been with those kids and
their coach since they were discovered
in order to make sure that they stayed
safe just need to be brought out now so
there is the announcement confirming
this news 12 bores and coaches leave the
cave and everyone is safe whoo yeah so
those 12 children the young footballers
and their coach are all out safe they
will be taken to hospital and reunited
with their family a government official
previously said that the first eight
boys rescued from the cave were in good
mental and physical health they are all
in hospital having many tests to make
sure that they are as well as can be
after a traumatic experience for them
stuck in that cave since the 23rd of
June alone for nine days with no sense
at all as to whether they would be found
and rescued they had gone into that cave
and in order to escape rising waters had
had to go deeper and deeper into the
cave network ending up two and a half
miles into the cave deep underground and
it was only after nine days with without
food that they were found safe but it
was then of course a very difficult
effort to bring them out alive these
pictures waving off some of the previous
evacuations from the rescue operation
obviously huge excitement every time one
person was brought out of the cave
Network that painstaking rescue effort
it meant that the boys had to be able to
scuba dive
in a state where they were physically
weakened having been inside that cave
they were helped out by a team of 90
expert divers 40 of them from Thailand
and 50 from abroad who guided the boys
through the darkness and some of the
flooded passageways towards the exit to
the Tam luang cave system it was
grueling not just obviously for that for
the divers the professional divers but
for those those boys who had to wear
full face masks in order to be able to
get out with a mixture of walking wading
climbing and diving along guide ropes
that were in place each boy as he made
his way out was accompanied by two
divers who would carry the boys air
supply but some of the areas of that
cave was so narrow that the divers
themselves had to take off their air
tanks to get through finally the final
stretch of getting out of the cave was
was a walk but it has been a very
dangerous mission to bring them out
safely and that was really underlined
when one former Thai Navy diver died in
the caves on Friday salmon Coonan had
been returning from a mission to give
the group air tanks when he ran out of
oxygen himself he lost consciousness and
sadly could not be revived so it has
been a painstaking a very difficult
operation to get those boys out in order
to facilitate the operation as quickly
as possible there was a massive pumping
operation to lower the water levels
inside the cave system to try to make
the journey out easier they were working
against time because there is predicted
heavy rainfall from tomorrow initially
it was thought that potentially the boys
could have stayed inside the cave with
food and oxygen being taken to them but
then it became clear that actually the
weather might make that impossible with
heavy rain forecast and already those
caves treacherous it was rising water
levels which meant that they were
trapped inside the cave when they had
gone in for a sightseeing expedition and
found themselves unable to leave they'd
abandoned their bikes having gone in
just expecting to be inside the cave for
a short visit
